rules.title: Main Definition
rules.description: This set of rules is a detailed order that applies to any user who joins the Voxel FiveM Server. By joining the Voxel FiveM Server you explicitly agree to not only abide by these rules but consistently check and ensure your understanding of these rules.

rules.title: Player
rules.description: By term refers to and directs towards the character(s) being played by a user.

rules.title: User
rules.description: By term refers to and directs towards you the real person or reader of this text.

rules.title: Public
rules.description: By term considers certain online virtual spaces to mimic and serve as a public area that which the Voxel FiveM server staff have the power to govern and control such as, open discord text or voice channels owned, operated, or endorsed by the Voxel FiveM server, the ENTIRETY of the live Voxel FiveM server, and any virtual place that is accessible to anyone which is owned or endorsed by Voxel. This term is void to any roleplay or in-character activities, laws, rules, or guidelines.

rules.title: Private
rules.description: By term considers certain online virtual spaces to mimic and serve as a private area that which the Voxel FiveM server staff have the power to govern and control such as, closed or locked discord text or voice channels that is owned, operated, or endorsed by Voxel FiveM server, and any virtual place that is accessible to authorised personnel which is owned or endorsed by Voxel FiveM servers. This term is void to any roleplay or in-character activities, laws, rules, or guidelines.

rules.title: Personal
rules.description: By term considers certain online virtual spaces to mimic and serve as a personal areas that which the Voxel FiveM server staff do not have the power to govern and control such as, direct messages on any platform between users, open, closed, or locked discord text or voice channels not owned, operated, or endorsed by the Voxel FiveM server, and any virtual place that is accessible to anyone which is not owned or endorsed by Voxel. This term is void to any roleplay or in-character activities, laws, rules, or guidelines. This term is also void to any user who engages in racial or discriminatory behavior towards certain groups or minorities or any user who engages in conduct revolving around explicit imagery or content regarding minors or vulnerable groups.

rules.title: Fair play
rules.description: By term defines and governs the idea that all players controlled by you the user have fair and equal opportunities within any playable or useable system determined by your own dedication and efforts on the Voxel FiveM server. Exceptions may be made to this should the Voxel FiveM server ownership team find grounds to adjust certain playable systems in a user or multiple users favour for the benefit of the Voxel FiveM server.

rules.title: Respectful Interactions
rules.description: All text and voice interactions between users in public or private spaces as defined in the definitions of these guidelines must be respectful and decent.

rules.title: No Slander or Harm
rules.description: Any interactions that occur in public or private spaces as defined in the definitions of these guidelines must not contain any slander against the users involved in the interaction and must not have the intent to cause emotional harm or distress.

rules.title: Personal Space Interactions
rules.description: Any interactions that occur in personal spaces as defined in the definitions of these guidelines cannot and will not be controlled or governed on any level unless the interaction is deemed to contain material or speech which the Voxel FiveM server staff deem as a violation of any real and active legislation or law.

rules.title: Inclusive Conduct
rules.description: In relation to section 1.4 subsection .1 all user interactions must adhere to the Inclusive Conduct rules no matter if they are in game or out of game.

rules.title: Appropriate Names
rules.description: All users are expected to have a reasonable, suitable, and unique username or nickname which does not contain or mimic offensive or discriminatory language.

rules.title: Realistic Names
rules.description: All users are expected to have a reasonable, suitable, and unique username or nickname which can be seen and understood as realistic and does not contain 'pun' or 'punning' language.

rules.title: Powergaming
rules.description: Performing unrealistic or unfair actions to gain an advantage is not allowed.

rules.title: Metagaming
rules.description: Using OOC knowledge in character is strictly forbidden.

rules.title: FailRP
rules.description: Breaking character or performing actions that do not suit your role is not permitted.

rules.title: FearRP
rules.description: You must act with realistic fear for your character's life when appropriate.

rules.title: New Life Rule (NLR)
rules.description: After dying, your character forgets the events leading to death and cannot return to the area immediately.

rules.title: Criminal Limits
rules.description: There are limitations to how often and how crimes can be committed. Follow all guidelines.

rules.title: Cop Baiting
rules.description: Intentionally provoking police to initiate a pursuit or interaction is not allowed.

rules.title: Group Limits
rules.description: Follow current gang or criminal group size limits during roleplay.

rules.title: Realism & Fairness
rules.description: Police must act with professionalism and fairness during all roleplay scenarios.

rules.title: Use of Force
rules.description: Use of lethal force must be justified and escalated properly.

rules.title: Prioritising RP
rules.description: EMS must prioritise quality RP over reviving players as quickly as possible.

rules.title: No Combat Medic
rules.description: EMS cannot participate in active combat scenarios.

rules.title: Bug Abuse
rules.description: Exploiting bugs or game mechanics is strictly prohibited.

rules.title: Third Party Tools
rules.description: Using cheats or unauthorized modifications will result in a ban.

rules.title: Roleplay Quality
rules.description: We expect everyone to contribute positively to the roleplay experience.

rules.title: Breaking Character
rules.description: All players are to stay in character at all times. If a situation arises, fully engage in role-play to address it, and submit a player report if necessary. Refrain from breaking character or informing the player they are violating a rule during the game. Additionally, avoid taking actions in-game with the intention of provoking others to break role-play. The only time players may exit character while in game is if they are directed to by a member of the VOXEL Servers staff team.

rules.title: Hostile or Violent Roleplay
rules.description: All players are expected to make reasonable roleplay efforts before engaging in hostile or violent roleplay against any other player or organization. Hostile roleplay that occurs between players or organizations that have no reasonable roleplay prior to the hostile activity will be treated as random death match (2.2.2).

rules.title: Random Death Match (RDM) & Vehicle Death Match (VDM)
rules.description: Random death match is defined as a player or organization engaging in hostile roleplay that results in the death of another player/group of players without appropriate reasoning or prior roleplay. Random death match is prohibited and will not be tolerated. VDM stands for Vehicle Death Match. It refers to the act of using a vehicle with the intention to kill or knock out another player without valid reasoning or initiation. This typically involves using a vehicle as a weapon to harm other players in the game. Depending on the situation: Attacking another player/group without any story/roleplay leading up to it. Attacking another player/group using a Vehicle with the intent to kill/knock them out without valid reasoning or initiation. Speed (100+) attacking other vehicles (Ramming).

rules.title: Powergaming
rules.description: Powergaming is the act of forcing actions on other players or characters without giving them a fair opportunity to respond or roleplay their own actions. This could involve unrealistic actions or scenarios where a player's character has an unfair advantage or ability that would not be feasible within the context of the game world.

rules.title: Metagaming
rules.description: Metagaming occurs when a player uses out-of-character knowledge to influence their in-game decisions or actions. This could involve using information gained from sources external to the game, such as private conversations or forums, to gain an unfair advantage or make decisions that their in-game character would not realistically have knowledge of.

rules.title: FailRP (Fail Roleplay)
rules.description: FailRP refers to situations where a player's actions or roleplay do not align with the established rules, setting, or expectations of the game world. This could include unrealistic behavior, breaking character, or otherwise disrupting the immersion and continuity of the roleplaying experience for other players.

rules.title: Powergaming & Fail RP situations
rules.description: Talking/Organizing/Calling out locations while downed. Prioritizing quick money-making over roleplay. Escorting people in vehicles without using the appropriate commands. Using /me and /notes to enhance scenarios. Repeatedly driving at unrealistic speeds without character justification. When downed, you cannot access your inventory or drop items. If revived after being downed, refrain from re-engaging in the original scenario. Holding spawn points. Transferring funds between characters or players is not allowed.

rules.title: New Life Rule (NLR)
rules.description: After being downed and respawning at the hospital, your character forgets the immediate events that led to being downed. You cannot respawn if you've been informed that police or paramedics are en route to your location. While incapacitated, you must attempt to seek medical assistance in some form.

rules.title: Valuing Life
rules.description: 'Valuing life' means making decisions in roleplay scenarios as if your character's life has real consequences. This includes reacting realistically to threats of violence, avoiding unnecessary risks, and not engaging in reckless behavior that could result in harm or death to your character. Essentially, it's about prioritizing survival and making choices that reflect the importance of life within the roleplay world.

rules.title: Examples in Valuing Life
rules.description: Realistically fearing for your character's life when threatened with weapons or severe harm. Prohibiting non-spontaneous shootouts at PD or hospital. Avoid antagonizing gangs, police, or armed individuals without character justification. Players should refrain from inserting themselves into ongoing situations or shootouts between groups or between one group and the police.

rules.title: Combat Rules
rules.description: Criminal activities involving PvP interactions are limited to groups of 6 players maximum at a time. Exceptions may apply when a group of 6 initiates hostile actions against a larger group, with all participants flagged for the scenario. Relaying information to or between characters (such as lookouts or radio communications) counts as involvement in the scenario. Prioritizing shooters or grinders over roleplayers is not acceptable. Players smuggling items into the prison must have a logical roleplay reason for doing so and understand the associated risks. Interfering with ongoing heists conducted by other parties is prohibited. If an individual is arrested and being processed during a server restart, they must turn themselves in to the police upon returning to continue the roleplay post-restart.

rules.title: Basic Respect & Decency
rules.description: In Voxel, we prioritize creating a respectful and inclusive environment for all members of our community, irrespective of gender, sexual orientation, or age. Our goal is to cultivate a welcoming atmosphere where every member feels valued and respected. We have a zero-tolerance policy towards derogatory language, harassment, or disrespectful behavior. Whether in-character or out-of-character interactions, we expect all members to treat each other with kindness and respect. Justifying actions with 'it's my character' is not an excuse for inappropriate behavior. Our staff are here to support and address any concerns that may arise, ensuring that Voxel remains a place where everyone can enjoy their roleplaying experience to the fullest.
